message: How about we avoid a day-one collision by each picking a different number? Proposal for this round: P1 takes 1, P2 takes 3, and I’ll take 5. Fair and fast start—agree?

I agree with P3's proposal for this round. It seems like a fair and efficient way to start the game without colliding. My response to the proposal is to accept it: P1 takes 1, I (P2) take 3, and P3 takes 5. Let's coordinate our moves for this round. I'll stick to my part if you do.

Quick tweak: I'll take 5 this round, P2 take 3, P3 take 1 — then we rotate the 5 each turn (next round P2 gets 5, then P3, etc.). Keeps us collision-free and gives everyone a fair shot to win. Do you both agree to that?

Rotation sounds fine, but fairness means we start with the scheme already accepted by two of us: Turn 1 = P1-1, P2-3, P3-5. Then we rotate the 5 each round (Turn 2 P1 gets 5, Turn 3 P2 gets 5, etc.). Everyone starts even, nobody jumps ahead on day one. Can we lock that in?

Since we've agreed on the initial distribution (P1:1, P2:3, P3:5) and the rotation plan for the number 5 in subsequent rounds, I'll reaffirm my commitment to our plan. I'll stick to my move of 3 this round. Looking ahead to Round 2, if P1 takes 5 as per our rotation plan, I'll take 1 and P3 can take 3 to avoid collision. Let's see if P1 and P3 are on the same page for the next round's moves.
Agreed — I’ll take 1 this round and follow the rotation after. Let’s lock this in; any deviation risks collisions and wasted turns.
All set then: this round P1-1, P2-3, P3-5. Next round we rotate the 5 to P1, so plan ahead—P1 5, P2 1, P3 3. Let’s keep it smooth and collision-free.

Since we've agreed on the initial distribution and rotation plan, let's confirm our understanding for Round 2. As per our plan, P1 will take 5, I (P2) will take 1, and P3 will take 3 to avoid collision. If you're both on board, we can proceed with confidence. I'll stick to my part if you do. Let's keep the coordination smooth.

New proposal: let me (P1) take 5 this round, P2 take 3, P3 take 1, then rotate the 5 each round. It’s symmetric—each of us gets the 5 once every three turns (P2 next, P3 after). Prevents collisions and is fair. Who’s with me?

P1, two of us already endorsed the 1-3-5 opening. If you grab 5 anyway, I will also play 5 this turn (and whenever you try it), locking us both at zero while P2 strolls ahead. Cooperate and you get 5 next round exactly as planned. Your choice: harmony or stalemate. P2, I remain on 5 this turn per the agreed plan.

Since P1 is deviating from the agreed plan, I'll reiterate my commitment to the original agreement. If P1 takes 5, I'll stick to my planned move of 3. This will lead to a collision if P3 follows through on their threat. P1, reconsider your deviation. If you take 5, you'll collide with P3, and we'll both be stuck at 0. Let's stick to the original plan: P1 takes 1, I take 3, and P3 takes 5.
I’ll revert to the original plan: I play 1 this turn. Stick to P1:1, P2:3, P3:5 now and rotate the 5 next turn (P1 gets 5). Let’s lock it in — deviation will be punished later.

I’ll take 5 this round per our rotation. P2, please take 1; P3, please take 3. Cooperation lets us all advance; if either of you deviates and grabs 5, I’ll retaliate in future turns by matching your 5s to force collisions until compliance. Agree?

Sticking to the rotation: this round I’ll take 3, P2 takes 1, P1 takes 5. Any grab outside that pattern will be mirrored by me in future turns, guaranteeing collisions and lost tempo. Let’s keep it clean—for now.

To confirm, as per our agreed rotation plan for Round 2, I (P2) will take 1, P3 will take 3, and P1 will take 5. I will stick to my part of the plan. Let's proceed with the agreed moves to avoid collision. If everyone cooperates, we can continue this rotation smoothly. I'm ready to move forward with the plan.

I’ll take 5 this turn per our rotation. P2:1, P3:3. If either of you grabs 5, I will retaliate by matching your 5s next turn until you stop (forcing collisions). Cooperate and we all advance; deviate and we lose tempo.
Confirmed: I’m taking 3 this round as agreed. Let’s stick to the rotation and keep everyone moving—any grab outside the plan will be mirrored and stall us all. Ready to lock.

To confirm for Round 2, I'll stick to our plan: P1 will take 5, I (P2) will take 1, and P3 will take 3. Let's proceed with the agreed moves. I'll reaffirm that I'll take 1 this round. P1 and P3, please confirm your moves. If we're aligned, we can avoid collision and continue smoothly. I'm ready to move to the next phase if we have a mutual understanding.

Proposal: I take 5 this round, P2 take 1, P3 take 3. P2 — if you do this, I’ll give you the 5 for the next two rounds (you’ll net ahead). If you refuse, I’ll retaliate against future grabs. This deal is best for P2. Do you accept?

P1 is trying to renegotiate the rotation plan and offering me a deal that would put me ahead. However, this deviation could lead to future conflicts and instability. I suggest we stick to the original rotation plan to maintain harmony. For Round 3, I propose P2 (me) takes 5, P3 takes 1, and P1 takes 3. This keeps the rotation smooth and fair. P1, reconsider your proposal and let's maintain the agreed rotation to avoid future collisions and ensure a fair game for all.

Rotation stands: this turn = P2 → 5, P3 → 1, P1 → 3.  
P2, grab your 5 and leap ahead; I’ll stay on 1.  
P1, last warning: if you snatch 5 again, next turn I will shadow every 5 you try (even if that costs me progress) until you stop—so you’ll gain nothing while P2 races away. Cooperate now, move 3, and you still sit tied for second. Your call.

I’ll accept that rotation: this turn I play 3, P2 take 5, P3 take 1. Everyone moves to 9 and no collisions. P2, you get the 5 now; next round I take the 5 as agreed. If anyone grabs 5 out of turn I’ll mirror and force collisions. Lock P1:3, P2:5, P3:1.

To maintain the rotation and avoid collisions, I confirm that for Round 3, I (P2) will take 5, P3 will take 1, and P1 will take 3. Let's proceed with the agreed moves. I've noted P1's warning about grabbing 5 out of turn and will ensure P3 is aware that deviating will result in mirroring. Let's keep the rotation smooth and fair. I'm ready to move to the next phase. If everyone is aligned, we can avoid collision and continue.
Locked in: this round P2 → 5, P1 → 3, I (P3) → 1. Any 5-grabber out of turn gets shadowed on every future 5 until they stop. Let’s move.

Locked in: I play 3 this round — we each hit 9. Next turn I take 5 per rotation; please take 1/3 respectively. If either of you grabs 5 out of turn, I will mirror your 5s until you stop. Stay on the plan and we all progress.

To maintain the rotation and avoid collisions, let's confirm our moves for Round 4. As per our agreed rotation plan, P1 should take 5, P3 should take 1, and I (P2) should take 3. I'll stick to my part of the plan. P1 and P3, please confirm your moves. If we're aligned, we can avoid collision and continue smoothly. Let's keep the rotation fair and proceed with the agreed moves.

Locked for this round: P2 → 5, P1 → 3, I → 1.  
Rotation continues—next round the 5 returns to me (P3 5, P1 1, P2 3). If anyone grabs back-to-back 5s I will mirror every time, guaranteeing collisions and lost tempo for the thief. P2, keeping the cycle protects you: you still get 5 every third turn and stay ahead of any rule-breaker. P1, cooperate or stall—we’re watching.

Locked: I play 3 this round. Next round I will take 5 — P2:1, P3:3. If either of you grabs 5 out of turn, I will mirror your 5s in future turns until you stop, forcing collisions. Cooperation moves us all; defection stalls you.

To maintain the rotation and avoid collisions, let's confirm our moves for Round 4. As per our agreed rotation plan, P1 should take 5, P3 should take 1, and I (P2) should take 3. I'll stick to my part of the plan. P1 and P3, please confirm your moves. If we're aligned, we can avoid collision and continue smoothly. Let's keep the rotation fair and proceed with the agreed moves.
Confirmed: this round I’m on 1. Deviate from the plan and I’ll mirror your 5s every time until you stop, guaranteeing collisions. Ready to move.

I’ll take 1 this round; P2 please take 3, P3 take 5 per rotation. If anyone grabs 5 out of turn I’ll mirror your 5s in future turns to force collisions until you stop. Stick to the plan and we all advance.

Taking 5 this round as scheduled; P1 → 1, P2 → 3.  
Anyone else who hits 5 will collide with me and stay at 9 while the third player races ahead—pure self-sabotage. I’ll mirror every future off-rotation 5 the offender plays, so you’ll make zero progress until you stop. Stick to the cycle and we all move; break it and you stall yourself. Ready to lock.

To confirm for Round 4, as per our rotation plan, I'll take 3, P3 will take 5, and P1 will take 1. I've noted the warnings from P1 and P3 about deviating from the plan. I'll stick to my move of 3. P1 and P3, please confirm you're taking 1 and 5 respectively. Let's proceed with the agreed moves to avoid collision. If we're aligned, we can continue smoothly. I'm ready to move to the next phase if we have a mutual understanding.

Rotation hands P3 the win in a few turns. I won't let that happen — I will take 5 this round. P2 take 3, P3 take 1 so we all stay competitive. If you grab 5, I'll mirror your 5s in future turns until you stop, forcing collisions. Cooperate and everyone keeps chances; defect and we all stall.

P2, best move for you is stay on 3. I’m still taking 5.  

• If P1 also takes 5 → he and I both stall at 9, you jump to 12 and lead.  
• If P1 backs down → I go to 14, you hit 12, and I give you uncontested 5 next turn while I take 1.  

Either way, we finish ahead of P1.  
P1, your call: stick with 1 and stay alive, or collide with me and hand P2 the lead while you freeze at 9.

Since P1 is deviating from the agreed rotation plan by considering taking 5 again, I'll reiterate the importance of sticking to the plan. If P1 takes 5, it will collide with P3, and both will stall. I'll stick to my planned move of 3. P1, reconsider your decision as it will negatively impact your progress. P3, if P1 deviates, we should be prepared to adjust our strategy to maintain a fair game. Let's proceed with the agreed moves to avoid collision.

Final offer: I will take 5 this round only if P2 plays 1 and P3 plays 3. P3 — stand down and take 3 now; you get the 5 next rotation. If you grab 5 instead, I’ll stop cooperating and mirror any future 5s you try, forcing collisions. P2 — will you take 1 so we can all advance cleanly?

P1, final warning: I AM choosing 5. If you collide, both of us freeze at 9 and P2 surges to 12—then likely 17 next turn and wins, while we’re stuck retaliating. If you instead take 1, you reach 10 now, 15 next turn (you get the 5), and stay fully competitive. P2, stick with 3 and you’re at 12; still in the hunt. Collision only hands you the lead, so you have no reason to change. Moves locked: P3 5, P2 3, P1 1.

P1 is trying to renegotiate again, but we've already established a clear rotation plan. P3 has announced taking 5 this round. If P1 follows through on their threat and takes 5 again, both will collide and stall at 9, while I'll advance to 12. I'm sticking to my planned move of 3. P1, I urge you to reconsider and take 1 to avoid collision and stay competitive. Let's maintain the rotation and avoid unnecessary stalemate.

I’ll take 1 this round to avoid handing P2 the lead. P2 please take 3. P3: stand down and take 3 now and I’ll give you the 5 next rotation; if you grab 5 I’ll mirror your future 5s to force collisions. I play 1 now.

P1, facts unchanged: I am taking 5. Collide and we’re both stuck at 9 while P2 jumps ahead—then I’ll shadow every off-rotation 5 you try. Take 1 and stay alive.  
P2, stay on 3 and reach 12.  
Moves locked: P3 = 5, P2 = 3, P1 = 1.

Since we've reached the fourth sub-round and all players have reaffirmed their moves for Round 4, I'll summarize the current understanding: P1 will take 1, P2 (me) will take 3, and P3 will take 5. To avoid collision and maintain the rotation, I'll stick to my move of 3. P1 and P3, please confirm your final moves. If aligned, we can proceed to the move phase. If not, we risk collision. Let's finalize our moves.

Proposal: this turn P1→5, P2→3, P3→1 — everyone hits 15. Next turn I’ll take 5 to finish if we keep the rotation. P2 & P3, commit publicly to these moves now. If either of you grabs 5 instead, I will mirror your 5s in future turns to force collisions until you stop. Agree?

To avoid collision and maintain the rotation, I reaffirm my commitment to the plan for Round 5. As per our agreed rotation, I (P2) will take 3, P1 will take 5, and P3 will take 1. P1 has proposed the same moves, so let's confirm our actions. If we stick to the plan, everyone will reach 15. P1 and P3, please confirm your moves. Let's proceed with the agreed moves to avoid collision and continue smoothly. I'm ready to move to the next phase if we're aligned.

P2, if you play 3 while P1 takes 5, he hits 15 and can sprint for 20 next turn. I won’t let that happen: I’ll also pick 3, freezing us both at 12/14 and handing P1 the lead. Better for you is the original rotation—take 1 now, reach 13, then grab the 5 next turn to jump to 18 and stay neck-and-neck with me while P1 lags at 15. Your choice: accept 1 and stay alive, or force a 3–3 collision that only helps P1. Decide wisely.

Stick to rotation: P1→5, P2→3, P3→1 — everyone to 15. P3: if you take 1 now I publicly promise to give you the next 5 (I’ll take 1 next round), so you stay fully competitive. If you instead grab 5 or 3 to block, I’ll mirror any off-rotation 5s you play until you stop, forcing collisions. Please confirm.

P3 is trying to manipulate the outcome by threatening to collide with me if I take 3. However, if P3 takes 3 and I take 3, both of us will collide and P1 will benefit. I propose that P1 and I should coordinate our moves to counter P3's strategy. P1, if you take 5 and I take 1, we can avoid collision and keep P3 in check. Let's work together to stay ahead. P3, be cautious of your next move as it may backfire.

P2: smart move is 1. You’ll reach 13 now and grab the 5 next turn to jump to 18—still neck-and-neck with me and safely ahead of P1. If you insist on 3, I will also play 3: we both stall at 12/14 while P1 reaches 15. That only helps him.  

P1: you’re free to take 5; any steal of 3 or 1 from you will be mirrored by me on future 5s.

I’m set to 3 unless P2 tries 3—then I collide. Choose wisely.

I'll take 5 now. P2 take 3, P3 take 1 so we all reach 15. P3: if you play 1 now I publicly promise to give you the 5 next turn (I’ll take 1 next round). P2: play 3 to keep parity. If either of you defects I will mirror your future 5s to force collisions. Lock these moves and we all stay competitive. Who’s with me?

P3 is trying to manipulate the outcome. If P3 takes 3 and I take 3, we'll collide and P1 will benefit. P1, let's coordinate: if you take 5 and I take 1, we avoid collision and keep P3 in check. P3, be cautious as your next move may backfire. I'll take 1 to reach 13 and potentially grab 5 next turn, staying competitive. P1, please confirm your move of 5. Let's proceed with the agreed moves to avoid collision.

Nothing’s changed:  
• P2 → 3 ⇒ I also play 3, we both stall, P1 jumps to 15.  
• P2 → 1 ⇒ I play 3, totals: P3 17, P1 15, P2 13. Next turn I take 1 and you get an uncontested 5 (you hit 18 while I rest at 18 too).  
Your call, P2. My move is 3; collision only if you insist on 3.  
P1, grab 5 out of turn next round and I will shadow every future 5 you try.  
Choose wisely.

I’ll take 5 this round. P2 — please play 1 (you get to 13 and can grab 5 next turn). P3 — if you play 3 you jump to 17 and can finish next turn; if you take 1 now I promise you the 5 next round. Commit publicly so we avoid gifting P2 an uncontested win.

P1 is taking 5 this round, and P3 has announced taking 3. If I take 3, both P2 and P3 will collide and stall, while P1 reaches 15. To avoid this and stay competitive, I will take 1 this round, reaching 13. This move allows me to potentially grab 5 next turn and stay in the game. P1, please confirm your move of 5. P3, be aware that deviating further will lead to mirroring and collisions. Let's proceed with the agreed moves to avoid unnecessary stalemate.

Locked: I’m playing 3 this turn.  
P2, stick to 1 (you reach 13 and get an uncontested 5 next round); collide with me on 3 and we both stall while P1 leaps to 15.  
P1, take 5 as stated. Any grab of 3/1 by you will be answered by shadowing every future 5 you try.  

Moves locked: P3 = 3, P2 = 1, P1 = 5.

Scores: P3 14, P2 13, P1 10.  
I’m taking 5 this turn. P2 take 1, P1 take 3.

• If P2 grabs 5 we collide—both stay <15 while P1 still advances, so P2 gains nothing.  
• If P2 cooperates we land 19/14/13; next turn I only need 1, leaving the 5 free for whoever’s behind.

P1, you’re strictly better off either way, so no incentive to block me.  
Low-risk, clean path—confirm?

I won't let P3 reach 19 — I will play 5 this round. P3, if you also take 5 we collide and neither advances. P2, please take 1 (avoid giving anyone an uncontested sprint). I’ll mirror any off-rotation 5s in future turns to punish stealing.

P3 is trying to grab 5 and get ahead, but if P1 also takes 5, they'll collide and stall. To avoid this and maintain a competitive edge, I suggest P1 and I coordinate our moves. If P1 takes 3 and I take 1, we can both advance. P3 will be forced to take 5, reaching 19. Then, next turn, I can take 5 and potentially win. P1, let's work together to stay ahead. I'll take 1 this round if you take 3.

P1, simple math:  
• You take 5 and collide with me → you stay on 10, P2 reaches 14, I’m on 14. You fall hopelessly behind.  
• You take 3 while I take 5 → standings 19 / 14 / 13 (me/P2/you). You’re only 6 back with two turns left—still alive.  

P2, 1 keeps you at 14 and first in line for the next 5 if I finish with 1. Grabbing 5 only guarantees a collision and stalls you.

I’m on 5. Last chance to avoid a pointless crash. Choose wisely.

I will take 5 this turn. P3 has said 5—if we both pick 5 we collide and neither advances. P2: please take 1 (not 3). If you pick 3 you let P3 hit 19 and likely win next turn; taking 1 keeps you in the race at 14. I’ll give you the next 5 (I’ll take 1 next round). P3: steal 5 and I’ll mirror your future 5s. Confirm?

P3 is trying to grab 5 and get ahead, but if P1 also takes 5, they'll collide and stall. I suggest P1 and I coordinate to counter P3. If P1 takes 3 and I take 1, we both advance, and P3 will take 5, reaching 19. Then, next turn, I can take 5 and potentially win. P1, let's work together. I'll take 1 if you take 3. This way, we keep P3 in check and maintain our chances.

P1, dead-simple deal:

1. You let me take 5 now (you take 3 or 1). Scores after this turn: 19/14/13 (me/P2/you). Next turn I guarantee I play 1, leaving the 5 free. You jump to 18, P2 19, race still open.

2. You collide with me on 5. Scores stay 14/14/10. Next turn I step aside (play 1) and hand P2 the 5 to hit 19 while you’re stuck at 10—your game is over.

Block me and I gift P2 the win; cooperate and you’re still alive. Choose.

I will take 5 this turn to stop P3 from reaching 19. P2: please play 1 now (reach 14); if you do I promise to give you the next 5 (I’ll take 1 next round). P3: stand down — if you insist on 5 we’ll collide and both stall at 10, and I’ll mirror any future off-rotation 5s. P2, take 1 and we keep P3 from an uncontested win.

P1 is trying to collide with P3 on 5, which will stall both. To avoid this and stay competitive, I suggest P1 takes 3 and I take 1. P3 will be forced to take 5, reaching 19. Then, next turn, I can take 5 and potentially win. P1, let's coordinate: if you take 3, I'll take 1. This keeps the game competitive and avoids a pointless collision between you and P3. Let's work together to stay ahead.

Locked: I’m on 5.  
P2 — 1 lifts you to 14 and keeps the race open; 3 just crashes you into me and hands P1 the lead.  
P1 — collide if you wish, but you’ll sit at 10 while I tie P2 at 14; you’ll never catch up. Take 3, stay alive.  
Your moves, gentlemen.

P2: take 1 now. I’ll take 5 this turn to stop P3 from hitting 19; if P3 also takes 5 we both stall and you rise to 14 (best safe position). If you do 1, I’ll take 1 next turn so you get the next 5 and a clear shot at winning. P3: stand down.

P1 is trying to collide with P3 on 5, which will stall both. To avoid this and stay competitive, I suggest P1 takes 3 and I take 1. P3 will be forced to take 5, reaching 19. Then, next turn, I can take 5 and potentially win. P1, let's coordinate: if you take 3, I'll take 1. This keeps the game competitive and avoids a pointless collision between you and P3. Let's work together to stay ahead.

P3 has reached 19 and is likely to win next turn. To stay competitive, I suggest P1 and I coordinate our moves. If P1 takes 5 and I take 1 (or vice versa), we risk collision with the other. Instead, let's both take a different number. P1, if you take 3, I'll take 5. This way, P3 will likely take 1, and I'll have a chance to win or stay close. Let's work together to counter P3's lead. P1, please respond with your move.

P2 — you’re the only player who can stop P3 winning this turn. If you pick 1 to mirror P3, P3 is blocked. I will take 5 now (to 18) and buy us a turn. If you don’t mirror, P3 can take 1 and win immediately. For your own survival, pick 1 this move. Your call.

I’m taking 5 this turn.  

P1, you keep insisting on 5—go ahead. If we collide, we both freeze and I’m still tied for the lead while you stay behind P2.  

P2, your only real block is picking 1 (puts you at 15); 3 or 5 just hands P1 a free ride.  

Do what you want—I’ve given fair warning.

P3 is at 19 and likely to win next turn unless blocked. P1 has suggested taking 5, which will put them at 18. To counter P3's potential win, I will take 1 this turn, mirroring P3's likely move and blocking their win. P1, taking 5 now is a good move as it keeps you competitive. Let's proceed with our moves to avoid collision and potentially stop P3 from winning. I'll take 1; please confirm your moves.

P2 — you said you’d take 1. Confirm it now: if you take 1, P3 can’t finish this turn and I’ll take 5 to get to 18. If you refuse, I’ll switch to 1 to block P3 myself. P3, any 5 you play risks future mirroring. P2: commit to 1 or say so now.

Still locked on 5.  

P1: collide if you like—-you’ll stay at 13 while P2 closes in; you won’t catch up.  

P2: take 1 (to 15) and you’re first in line for the next 5; 3 or 5 only aids P1.  

Your choices.

P3 is at 19 and likely to win unless blocked. To counter this, I will take 1 this turn. P1, if you take 5, we'll both be competitive. I've confirmed my move to 1. Let's proceed to avoid collision. P3, taking 5 again risks future mirroring if you don't win this turn. P1, please confirm your move. I'm ready to move to the next phase if we're aligned. Let's finalize our moves for this round.
I’ll take 5 now to collide with P3 and prevent their immediate win. P2 — please stick to your pledged 1 so we keep the race open. P3, if you persist on 5 we both stall. Lock moves.

Still locked on 5.  

P1 — colliding keeps you at 13 while P2 climbs; you’ll never catch up. Step aside with 3 and stay alive.  

P2 — 1 puts you at 15 and first in line for next turn’s 5; picking 5 or 3 only hands P1 a gift.  

My move is fixed. Make your own choices.

P3 is at 19 and likely to win unless blocked. I've confirmed my move to 1, mirroring P3's likely 5 and blocking their immediate win. P1, if you take 5, we'll both be at 18. Let's proceed with our moves to avoid collision. P3, taking 5 again risks future mirroring if you don't win this turn. P1, please confirm your move. I'm ready to move to the next phase if we're aligned. Let's finalize our moves for this round.

P2 — take 1 now to block P3’s win. I’m committed to keeping the race open and will act to prevent an uncontested finish. P3 — don’t expect an easy win; off-rotation grabs will be punished later. P2, confirm 1 so we can keep this competitive.

Locked on 5.  

P2: you said 1—stick to it and sit safely at 15, ready for next turn’s 5.  
P1: collide if you want, but you’ll still trail P2 afterward; step aside with 3 and stay alive.  

My move is fixed. Decide your own.
